qas.question: What is one dimension that communication is typically described along?
Who said that we should examine the impact a message has on the recipient of the message?
What acts are included in communication between parties?

answers.text: confer knowledge and experiences, give advice and commands, and ask questions

qas.question: The forms of the acts included in communication depends on what?
What is one target of communication?
What is described as having many major dimensions?
The destination or target is thought to be the medium of what?
Who didn't think a message would have any impact on the receiver?
Together, communication content, intent and form make messages that are sent where?
Transferring knowledge and experiences are the only types of what?

context: <b5_0><b6_0>Communication<b6_0/><b5_0/> is usually described along a few major dimensions: Message (what type of things are communicated), source / emisor / sender / encoder (by whom), form (in which form), <a0_0>channel (through which medium)<a0_0/>, destination / receiver / target / decoder (to whom), and Receiver. <a1_0><b7_0>Wilbur Schram<b7_0/><a1_0/> (1954) also indicated that we should also examine the impact that a message has (both desired and undesired) on the target of the message. Between parties, <b9_0>communication<b9_0/> includes acts that <a2_0>confer knowledge and experiences, give advice and commands, and ask questions<a2_0/>. These acts may take many forms, in one of the various manners of communication. The form depends on the <a3_0>abilities of the group communicating<a3_0/>. Together, communication content and form make messages that are sent <b8_0>towards a destination<b8_0/>. The target can be oneself, <a4_0>another person or being<a4_0/>, another entity (such as a corporation or group of beings).
